result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie Ann Sargent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs and Dna surcharge= $443- remainder of bond to be applied. Balance to be paid during probation.

No alcohol, drugs, or prescription drugs, except as prescribed by a doctor.
May not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
No possession of drug paraphernalia to include no needles or syringes.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol as a patron. May be in establishments for purpose of employment (bartending, waitressing etc.)

Def must submit DNA sample on 11-2-15
Pay DNA surcharge
Obtain a valid driver's license during probation
Defendant to submit to random drug tests not less than every 2 weeks (same test as used by Drug Treatment Court)
